title: Head of Finance & Compliance
description:
We are looking for a Head of Finance & Compliance who takes full ownership of budgets, insights, financial reporting, cashflow management, and compliance deadlines across our companies.



You will work directly with the founders and become the financial backbone of the brand, ensuring we stay financially disciplined, data-driven, and always ahead of deadlines.

This is a strategic + operational finance role in a fast-growing, multi-entity e-commerce brand.



Key Responsibilities

Budgeting & Financial Planning

- Build and maintain annual budgets for all entities.

- Create monthly, quarterly, and yearly forecasts.

- Monitor budget vs actuals and flag variances early.

- Identify cost-saving opportunities and efficiency gains.



Reporting & Insights

- Produce monthly financial reports for founders.

- Maintain dashboards (P&L, cashflow, expenses, margins).

- Provide insights on profitability by product, region, entity, and channel (Shopify, Amazon, etc.).

- Analyze spend (marketing, COGS, fulfillment, SaaS, salaries).



Cashflow Management

- Build and update rolling 13-week cashflow forecasts.

- Plan payment schedules and manage payables/receivables.

- Ensure liquidity is always sufficient in each entity.



Compliance & Deadline Management

- Maintain a compliance calendar for all entities.

- Ensure never missing a filing deadline in collaboration with the partnered accountant in this jurisdiction, including: NL BV, US LLC, HK Company, Dubai Company.

- Coordinate with accountants and ensure timely delivery.

- Track renewals, registrations, UBO updates, licenses, etc.

- Keep founders continuously updated.



Internal Finance Operations

- Implement finance processes & systems (expenses, approvals, spend control).

- Monitor recurring costs, vendors, tools, subscriptions.

- Support founders with financial decision-making.

- Assist with banking, payments, and documentation.



Strategic Support

- Help founders evaluate expansion decisions (US, EU, UK).

- Run scenario models (pricing, hiring, inventory planning).

- Contribute to financial discipline during scaling.



Requirements

Must-Have Skills

- Strong experience with financial planning & analysis (FP&A).

- Excellent budgeting, modelling, and reporting skills.

- Very strong in Excel/Google Sheets.

- Experience with cashflow management.

- Good understanding of accounting basics (but not an accountant).

- Experience coordinating with external accountants.

- Extremely detail-oriented (no missed deadlines).

- High ownership, structured, reliable.

- Experience in e-commerce / DTC / subscription businesses.



Nice-to-Have

- Knowledge of multi-entity or cross-border setups.

- Experience with Shopify/Amazon analytics.

- Background in auditing, FP&A, controlling, or consulting.



Personality & Culture Fit

- Highly organised and structured.

- Proactive, flags issues before they become problems.

- Founder-like ownership mentality.

- Comfortable working in a fast-moving, high-growth company.

- Loves numbers and clarity.

- Obsessed with deadlines.

- Wants to build something big.



KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)

Financial Clarity & Discipline

- Budget vs actual variance.

- Accuracy of monthly forecasts.

- On-time delivery of monthly reports.



Compliance

- 0 missed deadlines (VAT, CIT, filings, payroll, annual accounts).

- Compliance calendar always up-to-date.



Operations

- % reduction in avoidable costs.

- Accuracy of cashflow forecasts.

- On-time approval/payment of invoices and payroll.



Founder Support

- Quality & simplicity of insights and dashboards.

- Response time & accuracy on ad-hoc requests.



1. Send your cover letter, portfolio, and output to our hiring manager: 

2. Make sure the subject line is: Head of Finance & Compliance – [Your Name]

3. Ensure to attach your CV, and send us your OLJ Profile.

title: Children’s Storytelling & YouTube Content Creator
description:
Voiceover + Video Production



About the Role

We are seeking a warm, creative, and faith-centered storyteller to help bring Christian children’s books to life through voice and video.

This person will narrate children’s books with expression and heart, then turn those recordings into engaging YouTube videos that support faith, literacy, and confidence in children.

This is more than reading stories — it’s about creating safe, joyful, Christ-centered experiences that help kids feel loved, seen, and rooted in God’s truth.

If you love children, love storytelling, and want your creative work to have purpose and impact, this role is for you.



What You’ll Do

???? Voiceover & Narration

Record expressive, engaging readings of Christian children’s books

Use warmth, pacing, and character voices to capture children’s attention

Produce clean, high-quality audio in a quiet environment

Edit basic audio for clarity when needed



???? Video Creation & Editing

Turn narrated stories into simple, engaging YouTube videos

Add illustrations, slides, captions, music, and light animations

Sync visuals with audio for smooth storytelling

Design basic thumbnails or graphics

Export videos in YouTube-ready formats



???? Channel Support

Upload videos to YouTube

Write titles, descriptions, and tags

Follow a consistent posting schedule

Organize files and maintain clean workflows

Collaborate on ideas for new stories, series, and content formats



Role Expectations



We’re looking for someone who:

Delivers work consistently and on time

Communicates clearly and proactively

Takes ownership of projects from start to finish

Works independently with minimal supervision

Accepts feedback and revisions well

Brings creativity and fresh ideas

Genuinely cares about making a positive impact on children



This role is ideal for someone who wants to grow with the brand long-term — not just complete one-off tasks.



Skills & Qualifications



Required

Comfortable reading aloud with expression and confidence

Clear speaking voice and good microphone/audio setup

Basic video editing skills

Organized and self-managed

Passion for children and faith-based content



Preferred

Experience with children’s education, ministry, or childcare

Voiceover or audiobook experience

YouTube content creation experience

Graphic design or light animation skills



How to Apply (Required Materials)

To be considered, please submit ALL of the following. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



???? Voice Sample (Required)

1–3 minute audio recording of you reading a children’s story

Demonstrate warmth, clarity, and expression



???? Video Sample (Required)

At least one example of a video you created or edited

Must show narration + visuals + editing

YouTube or Google Drive link



???? Short Responses (Required)

Please answer:

Why do you feel called to create Christian children’s content?

What experience do you have working with children or faith-based spaces?

What editing tools/software do you use?

How many videos per week could you realistically produce?



???? Resume or Portfolio (Optional but helpful)



About Us

We create faith-based books and media that help children grow in confidence, character, and faith. Our mission is to combine storytelling and literacy with biblical truth so every child feels loved, chosen, and valued.

What We Offer

Training on legal procedures and industry-leading software.

A supportive team culture that values your contribution to the firm’s growth.

title: Payroll Implementation Project Manager
description:
Job Title: Payroll Implementation Project Manager

Location: Remote (Work from Home)

Job Type: Full-Time

Timezone: Pacific Standard Time



About Us:

We are a dynamic and client-focused on HR, payroll and benefit services firm that supports small to mid-sized businesses across the U.S. Our team is committed to delivering accurate, compliant, and efficient HR and payroll solutions. We are looking for a knowledgeable and detail-oriented Payroll Implementation Project Manager to join our remote team.



Position Overview:

The Payroll Implementation Project Manager is responsible for overseeing and coordinating payroll implementation projects across multiple clients. This role ensures that work is properly sequenced, tasks are assigned and completed on time, and projects move efficiently from intake through completion. The Project Manager works closely with back-office data teams and client-facing payroll implementation specialists to drive projects to timely and successful completion.



This role requires strong project management skills, attention to detail, and a working understanding of payroll concepts—without requiring deep payroll expertise.





Key Responsibilities:

Own the end-to-end coordination of payroll implementation projects

Define project scope, timelines, milestones, and dependencies

Identify the critical path for each client implementation

Create and maintain project plans, task lists, and timelines





Qualifications:

Proven experience in HR and payroll, specifically supporting U.S.-based companies

Strong understanding of U.S. labor laws, payroll taxes, and compliance

Familiarity with payroll platforms (e.g., ADP, Gusto, Paychex, QuickBooks Payroll, Paycom etc)

Experience with HR software and systems

Excellent organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Ability to work independently in a remote setting

Confidentiality and professionalism are a must





Task & Resource Management

Assign and track tasks across:

Data Operations Specialists (back office)

Payroll Implementation Specialists (client-facing)

title: Industrial Designer
description:
Mid-level industrial designer with one or more of the skill sets below.

4 to 10 years’ experience (Not an entry-level role)

1: Industrial Design Fundamentals

Drawing skills are essential

Form development and product aesthetics

User-focused design and basic ergonomics

Clear concept development through sketching (digital or hand)

Understanding of materials, manufacturing methods, and assembly

Ability to iterate based on feedback and constraints



2: CAD + Engineering Support

3D modeling in SolidWorks or Fusion 360

Clean, organized CAD suitable for engineering handoff

Basic understanding of tolerances and part breakdown

Experience supporting design-for-manufacture

Ability to revise models quickly and accurately



3: Visualization + Communication

Create clear presentation visuals for reviews and clients

Basic to intermediate rendering capability

Produce exploded views, callouts, and diagrams

Communicate design intent clearly through visuals

Support internal documentation and presentations



How This Work Is Structured

Remote work

Use your own computer and software 

Report to Design Director for direction and questions

Meetings early US central time (late to midnight Philippine time)

You will be assigned tasks and deadlines

Work from defined briefs with periodic feedback



What We’re Looking For

Creatives who express their ideas through hand drawing

Mid-level designers with real product experience

People who can execute without constant supervision

Clear communicators who respond well to feedback



About KAIA



KAIA is an Emmy-winning creative agency working at the intersection of design, engineering, and storytelling. Our work spans a wide range of project types and industries, with engagements that vary in scope and depth—from early-stage concept development to detailed, production-ready solutions. This variety is intentional; KAIA does not operate from a single template or repeat the same approach across clients. Each project introduces new constraints, users, and technical challenges.



The studio emphasizes practical problem solving over surface-level aesthetics. Design at KAIA extends beyond sketches and visuals into engineering-informed decisions, technical refinement, and execution that supports manufacturing and real-world deployment. The work is professional, high-end, and grounded in outcomes that matter.



KAIA operates as a small, experienced team that prioritizes clarity, accountability, and quality over scale. We partner selectively with clients and focus on work where thoughtful design and technical rigor create measurable value.



* response requires a resume and a portfolio *

title: TECH + AUTOMATION CONTRACTOR (TASK-BASED)
description:
Zapier | Flodesk | BoldTrail | Google Forms | Trello



I’m looking for a tech-savvy, systems-loving, problem-solving wizard to help me clean up, connect, and automate the back end of my real estate business — so it runs smoother, quieter, and smarter.



If you love when tools actually talk to each other, get weirdly excited about workflows working properly, and feel personally offended by manual data entry… keep reading.



Important upfront note:

This is a contract, task-based role. There are no guaranteed hours and no full-time commitment at this time.

That said, if we work well together, there’s strong potential for future contract projects.



A LITTLE ABOUT ME



I’m Sharayah — a real estate agent, business owner, mom, and systems enthusiast who believes business should feel simple, intentional, and human.



I care deeply about:

• elevated client experience

• clean, organized systems

• automation that actually works

• doing business with integrity

• building something sustainable (not chaotic)



Because I believe it's important that we get to know each other and we're both a good fit, write the word COFFEE in your job application header :) 



I don’t want half-working zaps, messy data, or “we’ll fix it later” systems.

I want it done right.



WHAT YOU’LL ACTUALLY BE DOING



Your role is to help connect and automate tools I already use — not reinvent them.



Projects may include:



• Zapier automations

Building, refining, and troubleshooting workflows using filters, paths, and triggers.



• Flodesk ? BoldTrail CRM (previously kvCORE) connections

Ensuring forms, tags, and data flow correctly and consistently.



• Google Forms ? BoldTrail CRM

Automating lead intake so information lands exactly where it should.



• Trello automations

Helping streamline boards, checklists, triggers, and workflows tied to my client journey and content planning.



Each project will be:

? clearly scoped

? task-based

? outcome-focused

? paid per task or milestone



YOU’RE A GREAT FIT IF:



• You genuinely enjoy systems and automation

• You are confident with Zapier and CRM integrations

• You test your work before calling it “done”

• You communicate clearly and ask smart questions

• You’re comfortable with contract, task-based work

• You value quality over rushing



Bonus (not required): experience with Flodesk, BoldTrail (kvCORE), Trello, or Google Workspace.



YOU’RE NOT A FIT IF:



• You’re looking for full-time work or guaranteed hours

• You prefer ongoing admin tasks

• You dislike troubleshooting

• You need constant supervision

• You rush through work without testing



WORK STRUCTURE



• Remote

• Contract / task-based only

• Flexible schedule (deadlines matter more than hours)

• Paid per task or milestone

• Opportunity for future contract work if it’s a great fit



HOW TO APPLY



Please send:



- A short intro about you

- Your experience with Zapier and CRM integrations

-  Tools you’ve worked with (Flodesk, BoldTrail, Google Forms, Trello, etc.)

-  A brief example of a task-based automation or workflow you’ve completed

- Confirmation that you understand this is a contract, task-based role



Applications that follow instructions closely will be prioritized.



FINAL NOTE



I value clear communication, clean systems, and people who take pride in doing things properly.



If you enjoy building workflows that run quietly in the background and make a business feel calm and organized — I’d love to hear from you.

title: Female Cold Caller with Hubspot Experience
description:
Our client is a premier label manufacturing business serving the U.S. market with a unique advantage: a robust U.S.-based customer support team paired with extensive international manufacturing capabilities. They specialize in high-volume label production, specifically pressure-sensitive labels and shrink sleeves, for brands that require scale and precision.



Their value proposition is built on competitive pricing, reliable lead times, and a consultative approach to high-volume packaging needs.



As a Business Development Representative, your primary objective is to fuel our sales pipeline by consistently booking qualified meetings with key decision-makers. You will work directly with our Company Owner and Internal Sales Representative to bridge the gap between initial outreach and a formal sales opportunity.



This is a pure prospecting and qualification role; you are responsible for opening doors and setting the stage for our sales leadership to close deals. You will have the autonomy to identify and qualify leads independently, while also receiving assigned leads as needed.



Key Responsibilities

1. Multi-Channel Prospecting: Execute outbound outreach via cold calling, cold
, and LinkedIn to generate interest.

2. Lead Identification: Research and identify prospects that fit our Ideal Customer Profile (ICP) within the Food & Beverage, Spirits, Nutraceutical, and CPG sectors.

3. Qualification: Conduct initial discovery to ensure prospects have active label needs, the authority to make decisions, and an openness to evaluating new vendors.

4. Calendar Management: Directly book qualified meetings onto the internal sales calendar.

5. Activity Logging: Maintain meticulous notes and activity logs to ensure full pipeline visibility.



Requirments: 

1. Should have experience using Hubspot 

2. Ensuring meetings meet all minimum qualification standards (authority, need, and timeline).

3. Seeing a high percentage of booked meetings convert into real sales opportunities for the internal team.



If you're interested, respond with your phone number and resume.

title: Legal AI Sales & Client Success VA (Operations & Administration)
description:
This role is a virtual assistant position with a sales and client success focus for AI Legal Assistant. You are responsible for the administrative coordination that keeps our sales and client success workflows running smoothly—scheduling, sales operations, free trial stage coordination, CRM discipline, and new-client administration.



Your accountability is operational: ensuring all steps are completed, documented, and actioned with precision—so every lead and client feels the experience is organised, professional, and well managed.



Two defining expectations of this role are:

Proactivity and Accountability (you anticipate next steps and remove blockers before they appear)



Exceptional communication (excellent phone manner and outstanding written English)



Key responsibilities

1) Sales administration and scheduling coordination

Book and coordinate meetings across multiple stakeholders; manage invites, joining details, agenda notes, and required attendees.



Maintain diary integrity for the COO and relevant stakeholders: avoid conflicts/double bookings, manage time zones, and keep scheduling clean and efficient.



Run appointment confirmation and reminder workflows via phone/SMS/email (as required) to reduce no-shows and protect 
ntum.



Manage rescheduling quickly and professionally, ensuring sessions are rebooked and not lost.



2) Free trial administration and stage coordination (process discipline)

Coordinate free trials across defined stages, ensuring all administrative steps are completed accurately and on time.



Track trial readiness and required inputs (e.g., stakeholder lists, checklists, session bookings, attendance confirmations, required information captured).



Ensure every trial has a clear status, owner, next action, and date—no ambiguity and no stalled trials due to admin gaps.



Escalate risks early when a trial is likely to stall (missing info, delayed scheduling, incomplete steps).



3) New-client administration (handover hygiene)

Coordinate the admin steps that occur when a client converts: client record completeness, stakeholder mapping, key dates, internal handover notes, and task creation.



Ensure documentation is consistent and complete so the team can execute without operational friction.



Track completion of required internal admin tasks and close gaps quickly.



4) Basic client and lead enquiries follow-up (non-technical)

Follow up and respond to basic enquiries from clients and leads (scheduling, process steps, “what happens next”, standard access instructions where defined).



Route product, security, pricing, legal, or complex questions to the appropriate owner and ensure the loop is closed with the client.



5) Team task accountability and blocker removal (internal coordination)

Track key tasks across sales admin, trial admin, and new-client admin to ensure owners complete them on time.



Proactively chase outstanding actions, confirm completion, and escalate blockers before timelines slip.



Maintain clear internal visibility: what’s done, what’s pending, what’s blocked, who owns it, and the deadline.



6) CRM & schedule management (ClickUp)

Record all interactions, updates, and booking outcomes within ClickUp with high accuracy and consistency.



Tag and organise leads/clients to maintain pipeline visibility and prioritisation.



Maintain CRM hygiene: accurate statuses, contact details, stakeholder roles, trial stages, next actions, and follow-up dates.



Ensure ClickUp is reliable enough to run day-to-day operations without “backchannel” updates.



7) Reporting & feedback

Provide regular updates on admin activity, lead status, appointment conversion/show rates, trial stage progression (admin completion), and outcomes captured.



Ensure company protocols regarding the recording of important metrics are followed diligently.



Share recurring questions, objections, and process bottlenecks observed to support continuous improvement.



8) Proactivity and communication excellence (explicit expectations)

Anticipate next steps and prepare them in advance (draft confirmations, pre-create tasks, prompt stakeholders early, keep records current).



Maintain an exceptionally high standard of phone and written communication: calm, concise, polished, and appropriate for senior legal stakeholders.



Maintain templates, checklists, and workflows that improve consistency, speed, and quality.



What success looks like

Leads, team and clients consistently feel the process is organised, responsive, and professionally managed.



No blockers caused by missing admin steps, unclear ownership, or poor follow-through.



High show rates due to strong confirmation/reminder discipline.



Trials and new-client admin progress smoothly with accurate stage tracking and clean handovers.



ClickUp/CRM is current and trusted: every record has a status, history, and next action.



Required skills and capabilities

Exceptional diary management and multi-stakeholder scheduling capability.



Excellent phone manner and highly professional presence.



Outstanding written English: clear, accurate, client-ready communication.



High attention to detail, speed, and comfort operating from checklists and workflows.



CRM experience is essential (ClickUp preferred; equivalent accepted).



High accountability and self-direction: you close loops and keep 
ntum without being chased.



Must be able to work Sydney business hours (Sydney timezone) reliably.



Preferred experience

Experience in the legal industry 

Experience in sales appointment setting or managing 

Familiarity with B2B SaaS sales operations, onboarding coordination, or client success operations.



Working requirements

Must be able to work Sydney business hours (Sydney timezone) reliably.

High availability during business hours for calls, scheduling, and urgent rescheduling.

Professional home/remote setup suitable for client phone calls.



Attributes we will screen for hard

Extreme organisation and attention to detail.

Fast execution without sloppiness.

Clear, confident communication (written + phone).

Proactive follow-through: you eliminate silence and ambiguity for clients.

Calm under volume: you can handle busy weeks without dropping standards.

Accountability: we don’t need to follow you up because it’s already done





HOW TO APPLY:



To apply for the position, please send:

A freshly recorded face-to-camera video explaining why you want the role and why you are the ideal candidate. 

Your resume

At the end of your application, please write the word "kangaroo" so I'll know you aren't mass applying and have read this entire job post.

title: eCommerce Coordinator
description:
HOW TO APPLY

/appzq4iqeIREQRVyo/pagS4ltOHDs97kQf9/form



Note: Only applications submitted through the link above will be considered.



---

Mission: To keep our eCommerce engine running smoothly by coordinating product launches, uploads, and site content with high precision and strong follow-through—so our storefronts stay accurate, on-brand, and on schedule.



Key Outcomes



- Monitor and manage all eCommerce-related tasks end-to-end, ensuring timely follow-up with the team and leadership until completion

- Actively monitor eCommerce-related questions or issues raised via Slack or
; create tasks/tickets as needed and drive them to resolution

- Maintain and monitor Airtable to ensure product upload statuses are accurate, deadlines are visible, and projects stay on schedule

- Oversee the product upload process across platforms, ensuring each product has complete and correct copy, imagery, and required assets before publishing

- Identify gaps proactively (missing copy, missing images, incomplete data, unclear approvals), coordinate ownership, and resolve blockers before launch dates are impacted

- Ensure accurate and timely image and copy uploads across all eCommerce platforms, including QA for formatting, spelling, links, and brand consistency

- Coordinate the copywriting workflow (draft ? review ? approval), ensuring product copy is completed and approved ahead of deadlines

- Coordinate promotions, banners, and on-site content updates, ensuring assets are briefed, created, approved, and ready in advance of launch

- Support the eCommerce team with miscellaneous operational and administrative tasks as needed, especially during heavy launch periods

- Work independently with a high level of productivity, efficiency, and attention to detail, escalating risks early and proposing solutions



Other Regular Responsibilities

- Utilize data and research to evaluate campaign performance, identifying key insights and providing actionable recommendations

- Maintain a well-organized and up-to-date repository of marketing assets (both internal as well as from competitors), such as graphics, promotional materials, and social media posts, ensuring easy access for the marketing team

- Assist the Marketing Director with various marketing-related tasks as needed



Who You Are

- 1–3 years of experience in eCommerce operations, digital operations, marketing operations, or a project coordination role (consumer products preferred)

- Highly organized with strong follow-through—you close loops and keep work moving

- Excellent attention to detail; you catch errors before they become customer-facing

- Strong written communication skills and comfort coordinating across multiple stakeholders

- Proficient with Airtable (or similar tools), Slack, and cloud-based docs; able to learn new platforms quickly

- Comfortable juggling multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment

- Proactive, resourceful, and solutions-oriented; you don’t wait to be told what to do

- Alignment with the company's mission and values, which can be found here: 
.



About HiEnd Accents

HiEnd Accents designs and creates everyday luxury bedding and linens, sheeting, decorative pillows and other home textiles. Founded in 2005 and based in Dallas, Texas, our mission is to elevate our customers' lives via beautifully designed home textiles that deliver quality and value.



As a family-owned business, we’re committed to personal service and long-term relationships. description:
HOW TO APPLY

If this role feels like the perfect fit and you meet the qualifications, we invite you to learn more about our team in the Philippines and submit your application here:




/appzq4iqeIREQRVyo/pagRcEzAT2P39Rr13/form



Note: Only applications submitted via the above link will be considered.



JOB DESCRIPTION



We are looking for a detail-oriented and reliable Accounts Payable Specialist to join our close-knit accounting team. In this role, you will be in charge of making sure our company pays all of its bills on time and correctly, including vendors in the U.S. and overseas. If you are great with numbers, organized, and love making sure things are done right the first time, this job is for you.



WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING



- Take ownership of the full A/P process: receive and check invoices, enter them into our system, route them for approval, and make sure they get paid.

- Handle international vendor payments (payments to overseas factories). Carefully review each invoice for accuracy, match supporting documents (like shipping records and POs), and flag any inconsistencies before releasing payments.

- Double-check all invoices to ensure accuracy and compliance with company policies.

- Keep vendor contact info and payment details up to date in our system.

- Match vendor statements with our records and investigate any mismatches or errors.

- Ensure each expense is booked to the correct account, department, or project.

- Run weekly payment batches, including checks, ACH, credit card, and wire transfers.

- Respond to vendor
s and calls professionally and quickly.

- Work with other departments to solve payment issues and help prevent future ones.

- Support month-end close and annual audits by preparing A/P reports and documentation.

- Regularly create reports to help track payables and support financial decision-making.



WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR



- Bachelor's degree in Accounting or a related field

- 5 to 7 years of hands-on Accounts Payable experience

- Strong skills in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.)

title: Real Estate Administrative Assistant
description:
Real Estate Administrative Assistant

Full-Time | Stable Long-Term Role | Reliable pay, paid time off, and long-term career stability



READ THE DETAILS AND Apply here: 
/47MsOW8.



About the Role

We are looking for a Real Estate Administrative Assistant to support core real estate operations by managing permits, inspections, and transaction coordination. In this role, you will handle market analysis, prepare and send offers, follow up on inquiries, and ensure every item is tracked and completed from start to finish. This is a long-term, full-time opportunity for someone who values accuracy, follow-through, and steady work in a supportive environment.



Key Responsibilities

1. Own real estate administrative items from initiation through completion, ensuring permits, inspections, offers, and follow-ups are fully closed with no loose ends.

2. Apply for and manage permits and inspections, troubleshooting failed or delayed items by identifying root causes, coordinating corrective actions, and following through until approved or passed.

3. Maintain accurate tracking of permits, inspections, offers, and property activity, providing proactive status updates so progress and blockers are always visible.

4. Complete market analysis and prepare real estate offers using MLS software (approximately 10 offers per month), ensuring accuracy and completeness.

5. Send offers and related documents via DocuSign and monitor execution through final completion.

6. Handle professional coordination calls and
s with municipalities, inspectors, and real estate agents to clarify requirements and resolve issues (no sales or cold calling).

7. Research foreclosure and off-market properties, document findings, and maintain organized tracking in Google Sheets.

8. Follow documented processes and workflows consistently, with persistence and attention to detail when managing long-running or repetitive coordination tasks.



Must-Have Skills

1. Proven ability to own tasks from initiation to completion and consistently close loops without reminders.

2. Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, especially when resolving permit or inspection issues.

3. High attention to detail and accuracy with permits, offers, and compliance-sensitive documentation.

4. Comfort with process- and SOP-driven work, following documented workflows consistently.

5. Clear, professional English communication skills for coordination calls and
s with municipalities, inspectors, and real estate agents (non-sales).

6. Patience and persistence with follow-up-heavy, long-running tasks until fully resolved.



Nice-to-Have Skills (Bonus)

- Experience with QuickBooks or basic real estate bookkeeping.

- Experience researching foreclosure or off-market properties.

- Familiarity with documenting or improving processes and workflows.



Tools You’ll Use

- MLS software

- DocuSign

- Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, Gmail)

- Local municipality permitting portals

- QuickBooks (bonus, not required)



Work Schedule

Full-time, Monday–Friday, aligned with US business hours (exact schedule and time zone to be confirmed during hiring).



Our Values

- Integrity – Doing what’s right with transparency and accountability.

- Excellence – Delivering high-quality results using modern tools.

- Innovation – Adapting quickly and solving problems proactively.

- Resilience – Reliable and steady support for success.

- Collaboration – Thriving in a positive, team-oriented environment.



Why You’ll Love Working Here

Our tea
mbers say this is more than just a workplace — it’s a supportive community where you can grow your career and feel valued. Here’s what you can look forward to:

- Long-term stability

- Reliable pay and bonus opportunities

- Paid leave and holidays

- Training and development

- Community and recognition

- Career security with continuous role opportunities

title: Content Manager (Part-Time, Contract)
description:
Company: Pewcentric

Hours: ~15 hours/week

Schedule: Flexible, async-friendly

Reporting to: Founder

Role Type: Contract / Long-term preferred



About Pewcentric

Pewcentric is a growing online marketplace connecting buyers with trusted sellers of firearms accessories, gear, and related equipment.



We focus on:

- Credible sellers

- Clear product information

- Craftmanship

- A community-driven approach to commerce



This role is best suited for someone who is comfortable working in the firearms accessories space and understands how to present products and sellers in a professional, compliant, and credible way.



About the Role

We’re looking for a Content Manager to own content execution and contribute thoughtful input on what we publish and why.



This is a hands-on role that blends:

- Operational ownership (shipping content consistently)

- Creative judgment (feedback on videos, posts, and calendar)

- Modern tooling (AI-assisted workflows, templates, systems)



You will not be responsible for filming or advanced video editing… but you will help shape how content performs and resonates.





What You’ll Be Responsible For

1. Video Coordination & Creative Input (Core Priority) 

You will:

- Take founder script and video (vision) and create tangible video instructions for video editor / producer

- Coordinate weekly with an external video editor / producer through multiple rounds of edits

- Manage delivery of:

     - 1 long-form YouTube video per week (founder-led)

     - 3 short-form clips per week

- Review videos and provide feedback on:

     - Clarity

     - Pacing

     - Hook strength

     - Overall quality

- Create thumbnails (Canva or similar)

- Publish videos across:

     - YouTube

     - Instagram

     -

     - TikTok



You are expected to have an opinion and share recommendations… not just upload files.



2. Editorial Calendar & Content Planning 

- Maintain a simple, living editorial calendar

- Participate in weekly planning discussions with the founder

- Provide input on:

     - What content is working

     - What should be adjusted or doubled down on

- Help ensure a balanced mix of:

     - Seller features

      - Product education

     - Marketplace credibility content



3. Blog Publishing & Repurposing 

Publish ~3 blog posts per week

Blog content sourced from:

- Video transcripts

- Existing recorded content

Editing for:

- Structure

- Readability

- Basic SEO hygiene

No original long-form thought leadership required



4. Social Distribution 

- Cross-post content with short, clear captions and hashtags

- Ensure content is formatted correctly per platform

- Maintain a consistent publishing cadence

- Weekly review of followers to tag potential leads/new sellers

- Support weekly seller-focused features coordinated with the founder



5. Newsletter Execution 

Send 2 newsletters per month:

- One for buyers

- One for sellers

Use existing templates

Content sourced from videos, blogs, and seller features





6. Content Analytics Management

Monthly review of social analytics and GA4 to assess:

- Top and lowest performing content

- Content that results in conversions (website visits, sign ups, purchases)

- Best times and days to post



7. Communication & Ops

- Weekly 30-minute check-in with the founder

- Async updates via Google Meet or

- Flag issues, delays, or ideas proactively

- Keep content workflows moving smoothly



Skills & Experience We’re Looking For

- Experience managing or publishing content for social platforms

- Comfortable using:

     - Social media platforms and schedulers

     - AI tools (ChatGPT, transcript tools, caption assistance, etc.)

     - Basic photo editing tools (Canva, Photoshop, or similar)

- Strong attention to detail and follow-through

- Clear written communication

- Ability to give constructive creative feedback

- Organized, reliable, and self-directed



What Success Looks Like

Within 30 days:

- Content is published consistently and on schedule

- Video ? clips ? blog ? distribution runs smoothly

- Editorial calendar is realistic and well-maintained

- Founder feels supported with both execution and input

- Work stays within ~15 hours/week



Ideal Candidate

This role is a great fit if you:

- Enjoy both execution and creative problem-solving

- Like working with structure but improving it over time

- Are comfortable sharing opinions respectfully

- Value consistency, quality, and 
ntum

- Are interested in marketplaces, gear, or enthusiast communities



How to Apply

Please include:

- A short video (Loom or other) on why this role fits how you like to work

- Examples of content or channels you’ve helped manage (links preferred)

- Resume and/or work samples

- Confirmation that you’re comfortable working in the firearms accessories space

title: Video-Podcast Producer for Podcasts for Podigy
description:
(NOTE: Anyone who does not follow the application instructions EXACTLY will not be considered. READ FULLY.)



Hey! I’m Justin, founder of Podigy – one of the top video-podcast agencies serving holistic health and wellness thought leaders around the world.



I’m a professional sound engineer by trade with deep experience in world-class podcast production, and I also run a growing music creator brand with nearly 1 million followers across social platforms: 



Podigy has grown fast over the last few years and we’re now a team of almost 25. We take a lot of pride in being a well-organized, supportive, and genuinely fun place to work. Our Slack is always buzzing with life updates, wins, encouragement, and real teamwork.



Podcast production is the heart of what we do, and our editing team is one of the most important parts of the company. We’re currently looking to bring on 2 new editors who want to grow with us long-term.



What we’re looking for:

- High attention to detail – mistakes happen, but reliability and accuracy matter a lot.

- Team player mentality – you’ll be collaborating with multiple people every week.

- Strong follow-through on deadlines – if anything ever comes up, clear and immediate communication is essential.

- Proven skill in producing and editing video podcasts – show us work you’re genuinely proud of.

- Active communication – we expect daily updates and consistent presence in Slack so nothing falls through the cracks.



What you get:

- A truly supportive, positive work culture

- Reliable, ongoing work

- Regular opportunities for raises

- The chance to work on podcasts for some of the most respected leaders in holistic health



If this sounds like the kind of team you want to be part of, complete the application.



Examples of our shows, and the type of content style you’d would be editing: 

Kelly Brogan MD

Conscious Success

The Way Forward

Hormone Healing RD



Responsibilities:

Learn Podigy’s method for producing gold-standard audio and editing high quality YouTube podcast episodes.

Implement notes from clients when editing content

Use 
 to manage all of your deadlines 

Be active in the team Slack channels and communicate daily with the team

Avoid mistakes as much as possible, and fix mistakes within 24 hours if & when they are made



Requirements (You Must…)

- Have in-depth knowledge of:

> EQ & Compression

> Noise Cancellation & Gates

> Repairing Damaged Audio

> Inserting External Files (Intros/Outros)

> Removing filler words & dead space

> Cutting Video + Audio Simultaneously

> Loudness Levels

> Fading

> Exporting Files and Uploading Files

- Have basic knowledge of Google Drive, Slack, and 
.

- Be able to reply to messages very quickly.

- Be self-motivated and energetic.

- Be honest, trustworthy, and reliable.

- Be willing to be part of a growing and expanding company.

- Available to work on weekends (rare, but occasionally necessary)

- Available to work full-time



How to Apply

- Interested candidates will answer the following questions:



1. How long have you been editing and mixing podcasts?

2. What podcast editing software are you proficient in?

3. Describe your editing process - including audio & video production.

4. Roughly how many podcast episodes have you edited?

5. How long would it typically take you to edit a 1 hour podcast episode?

6. Tell me about a challenging podcast production issue you encountered while working and how you resolved it.

8. What do you enjoy most about editing podcasts?

9. Why do you want to work with our company specifically?

10. If you could improve one thing about your editing skills, what would it be?

11. Based on the work examples listed above, do you believe you could edit something at the same level of quality? 



Screening Process:

Qualified candidates will receive a video podcast episode to edit as a trial.

title: Demand Planning Analyst
description:
unybrands was established in 2020 by a group of partners united by a shared vision: to build the leading next-generation e-commerce platform for micro-brands. Headquartered in Miami, the company has a global presence with teams in Berlin, London, New York, and China.



unybrands acquires e-commerce businesses that sell both on and off Amazon. Once acquired, these brands are integrated into unybrands' platform, where operations are optimized, business performance is enhanced, and expansion into new product lines and markets is driven. Currently we have acquired 30 brands including Pet Care, Personal Care, Home Care, Supplements, Baby & Juvenile, Garden & Outdoor, Sports & Fitness, and Home, Lifestyle Culinary & Arts. Through expert management and robust infrastructure, unybrands empowers e-commerce brands to scale and thrive.



We are seeking a meticulous and highly organized Demand Planning Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will play a critical role in supporting our demand planning processes, generating insightful reports, and ensuring smooth operational execution. This role involves working closely with various BI tools, Excel, and other software to produce accurate data analysis and presentations for both executive and operational audiences. 



*** please
 your resume: 





Key Responsibilities: 



- Drive demand insights by supporting weekly demand reviews — generating out-of-stock reports, identifying demand outliers, and analyzing forecast accuracy to enable smarter decisions 



- Generate Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) reporting packages, preparing and presenting performance KPIs to different Stakeholders. 



- Create comprehensive S&OP decks using BI tools and PowerPoint, integrating various data visualizations. 



- Collaborate and influence during weekly and monthly operations and business meetings, updating action items and ensuring ongoing process improvements. 



-Review inventory management reports, Purchase Order pipeline, inventory health and excess inventory levels. 



 



Overall Tasks: 



- Thrive in a fast-paced environment, demonstrating flexibility, adaptability, and strong prioritization skills across multiple projects and stakeholders 



- Collect and consolidate data from various portals and store them in designated folders. 



- Prepare detailed decks for executive reviews and operational alignment meetings. 



- Periodically refresh data pipelines in Excel to ensure up-to-date information. 



- Navigate BI systems (Tableau, Power BI, Looker...) to extract and snapshot key outcomes. 



- Manage demand spike alerts and coordinate with internal stakeholders for prompt resolution. 



- Track and update action items from operations planning meetings. 



 



Qualifications: 



- Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Data Analytics, or related fields 



- Proven experience in supply and demand planning or a similar analytical role 



- Advanced Excel skills and BI, data visualization tools. Knowledge of SQL and ODBC connections, as well as Big Query experience, is a plus 



- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal 



- Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment 



-Eagerness to get hands-on with real world data- cleaning, structuring and transforming into useful information, ready to be used by Stakeholders 



-Proven ability to work independently from end to end as part of a team. 



unybrands is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment without any regard to race, skin color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, and age. Nor are applicants discriminated against based on disability or protected classes.?
